column5: We were with Air Mont-Laurier and had to pay $9 for a 4 L jug of water and $17 a gallon for gas. Just wondered if those charges were normal or a bit high?

On the high side I wold say. Paid $10 plus 13% HST in camp last week. Depending where the camp is located probably dictates the cost of everything. Especially if it has to be flown in or remote location for delivery. $9 for just over a gallon of water? Again the above applies, but dang!Pooch
$9 bucks for a gallon of water, WTF? No way in h**l. I would have taken my chances and drink from the lake. Fisherman 1792

Not much can be done on your part with regards to gas charges - except for not traveling as far from the cabin - if feasible. With regards to $9.00 for a gallon of water, you just have to look into a water filtration system. I have seen these in the quart to half gallon size. Won't take too many gallons for the system to pay for itself.
don't bring any water in - use this:https://www.walleyecentral.com/forum...light=platypus saw one for $120 on ebay - splitting the cost between the group makes this a bargain. phish
